The documentary titled Breaking History: Bigfoot Captured was aired on the History Channel on 10 November 2015, which purportedly documented the successful hunt and capture of a Bigfoot creature.
The episode was presented in a documenta: leading many viewers to believe that a Bigfoot creature had actually been captured during the filming process.
However: the program included a disclaimer stating that it featured "some dramatization" and ended with credits listing actors who pretended to be Bigfoot hunters.
The History Channel contracted Idaho Sta: s Robotics and Communication Systems Engineering Technology program to create a skeleton of the mythical beast to be used in the show, as no actual Bigfoot skeletons have been unearthed. The skeleton was reconstructed based on the physical features of extinct animals such as the Gigantopithecus blacki and the Neanderthal.
